div.p: On the Security of LGs Knock Codes
LG KNOCK CODES: A DIFFERENT WAY TO UNLOCK
- Users select/recall a series of 6 to 10 knocks on a 2x2 grid
- We estimate 700,0002,500,000 users in the US alone
- Used with the screen off or on
How secure and usable are Knock Codes?
Mobile only with three treatments: control blocklist larger grid size
Two online user studies using Amazon Mechanical Turk
Each participant created two Knock Codes
Has complete knowledge of the frequency order Knock Codes, from most to least frequent
Knows a subset of the Knock Codes and constructs a model based on that observed distribution
Using a blocklist does not affect general entry time
However, other methods such as PINs and patterns have a recall rate of 95%*or higher
*Harbach et al. Its a hard lock life: a field study of smartphone (un)locking behavior and risk perception SOUPS 2014
*Markert et al. This PIN can be easily guessed IEEE Symposium on Security and Privacy 2020
First user study and security analysis of Knock Codes
Knock Codes offer less security relative to other mobile authentication
Using a blocklist with Knock Codes improves security
Participants find Knock Codes mostly unusable and insecure
Participants are open to new methods of mobile authentication
